ygData.subject: Heads-up: Broken canonicalization rule in 1.10.0.
ygData.msgSnippet: FYI, the (new) StripWWWNRule canonicalization rule does not work as advertised

From: Michael Stack <stack@...>
Subject: Heads-up: Broken canonicalization rule in 1.10.0.
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=168599281; y=EX_NXGlIqZqB3ekGdM0Zy_anjFqtdgiVtk6pRIu4_j3ea3JSSyUzMmYV
X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

FYI, the (new) StripWWWNRule canonicalization rule does not work as 
advertised 
(http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1560782&group_id=73833&atid=539099).  
It claims that it works as a superset of  the StripWWWRule but in 
actuality, StripWWWNRule removes the www[0-9]* host prefix only if the 
numeric is present: i.e. www001.example.org will be canonicalized as 
archive.org but www.archive.org will pass canonicalizations unscathed as 
www.archive.org.  The upshot is we'll crawl both www.example.org and 
www0001.example.org as though they were different sites: i.e. lots of 
duplicate crawling.

The default profile uses StripWWWNRule.

Workaround is to add the StripWWWRule beside the StripWWWNRule to the 
set of canonicalizations.

We'll likely make a point release sometime soon but want to give 1.10.0 
more burn-in time to see if anything else ugly makes a show.

Yours,
Internet Archive Webteam.
